author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: RJHS struggles with Benton
text: slideshow BENTON — The Russellville Whirlwinds spooked but did not defeat the undefeated Benton Junior Panthers on Thursday. The Whirlwinds took a 13-7 lead with 3:52 left in the third quarter, but Benton fired back on the next play to go up 14-13. The Junior Panthers eventually won 21-13.The Whirlwinds (3-5, 2-5 River Valley Central Conference) couldn’t capitalize on two Benton turnovers but were able to head to halftime with a 7-7 tie. Benton tossed an interception to Bryson Kordsmeier on their opening possession, but Russellville was forced to punt four plays later.Four plays after that, a Junior Panther fumble was scooped up by Jason Collins. Again, the Whirlwinds were forced to go three-and-out.Benton (8-0, 7-0) finally got rolling and went 64-yards in nine plays to go up 7-0 with 3:15 left in the first quarter.Russellville went 61-yards in eight plays in response, converting a third-and-11 on a 29-yard pass from Rhett Adkins to Kordsmeier. Adkins hit Langston Parker on the 2-yard with 1:21 left in the half. The Whirlwinds had all three timeouts, but they wouldn’t need them. Drake Adkins scooped up the final two yards to tie the game 7-7 after the successful PAT kick.Russellville took another shot at the end zone with 14.9 seconds left in the half, but the deep pass was picked off on the 4-yard line. Benton took a knee the ball to drain the rest of the half.The Whirlwinds took a 13-7 lead with 3:52 left in the third after missing the PAT kick. Drake Adkins kicked things off with two consecutive runs for 15 yards, before Rhett Adkins connected with Kordsmeier for 25 yards to the Benton 16. Russellville worked its way to a fourth-and-two on the 9-yard line, but opted for a touchdown rather than a field goal. Adkins hit Collins on the play-action pass across the middle to give the Whirlwinds their first lead of the game.It wouldn’t last long.After taking over on their own 36, Benton tore off 64 yards, untouched, for a touchdown and the lead.Russellville went back to work on the 50. Adkins converted a second-and-22 with a pass to Collins but fumbled four plays later to give the Junior Panthers possession.Benton capped another drive with a 27-yard rushing touchdown to set the final score. The Whirlwinds took over with 2:49 left in the game and two timeouts but turned the ball over on downs on their own 27.The Junior Panthers graciously drained the remainder of the clock with several victory knees.Adkins finished the game 11-of-19 for 165 yards, one touchdown and one interception. Kordsmeier had 105 yards on six catches. Drake Adkins had 32 yards on 10 carries.Russellville will host Cabot White next week.
